attributes.action: Condemn the Israeli government killing innocent civilians and unarmed protesters
attributes.background: Condemn the Israeli government for killing innocent people like the 21 year old nurse who was shot dead on 1/06/18 by Israeli soldiers while treating injured Palestinian protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
The death of this nurse cannot go un noticed. This killing must stop and there is more the British government can do to ease matters into peace.  

Targeting medics let alone unarmed protesters is a war crime under the ***Geneva Convention***.

attributes.action: Revise firearms certificates to allow for wider gun access but harder to obtain
attributes.background: We want to see revisions to Section 1 firearms certificates so that law abiding, mentally healthy citizens have the privilege and freedom to own a wider range of weaponry for the purposes of sports and protection of private property.
attributes.additional_details:
The revisions I am proposing are:
Allow for the sale of semi-automatic, centre-fire rifles to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the sale of pistols to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the protection of private property to be a reason for owning a firearm
Reduce the length of firearm certificate to be reduce from 5 to 1 year so mental health and criminal checks happen more often
Change the price of a certificate to make renewal easy but entry hard

attributes.action: Remove standardised testing from schools in the U.K.
attributes.background: I believe strongly in the fact that every child is different and deserves to be tested as an individual not as a collective group. Tests are not suitable for every child.
attributes.additional_details: As Frederick J. Kelly, the man who invented standardised testing, once said “These tests are too crude to be used and should be abandoned.” Every child is different which is what they are told throughout school, but when it comes to it every child is tested in the same way, not taking into consideration their abilities and strengths. Tests put a lot of unnecessary pressure on both schools and students.

attributes.action: Re-introduce a rail network along the old Wyre Forest / Tenbury line
attributes.background:
Instead of investing millions in making it quicker to get to London rural communities need better financial support to get to other cities. 
In areas such as Tenbury/Cleobury/Bewdley the public transport network does but support the ambitions of the community and prevents commuting and studying.

attributes.action: Introduce an Act making it mandatory to manufacture British passports in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom should, like many other countries, restrict where it's passports are made and  insist that it's passports are manufactured, by law,  in the United Kingdom by a United Kingdom registered company.

attributes.action: Please give every child in England the opportunity to study Classics.
attributes.background: Threatened by govt funding cuts and a reputation of elitism & irrelevance, the study of Classics in state schools is in peril.Yet, it continues to be taught in most private schools-for good reason. Classics explores what is eternal about humanity. It teaches us to think & debate. Skills we all need.
attributes.additional_details: Classical ideals of wisdom & virtue formed the foundations of our education system. Increasingly however, we have adopted a more utilitarian approach to the education of the majority: where the focus is the creation of individuals whose labours can best serve the economy.The type of education system we create, determines the type of society we create. A stressful, competitive system that focuses on preparing students to be valuable to an economy, does not nurture the healthiest individuals - nor the healthiest societies.

attributes.action: Begin talks to expel Russia from the UN security council
attributes.background: In light of the poisoning of Sergei Skripal with a chemical agent (the first time in Europe since WW2), the poisoning of Alexander Litvinenko, the use of chemical weapons in Syria and the annexation of Crimea, Russia should be expelled from the UN Security Council.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of using big cats as photo props with the Thai goverment
attributes.background:
Recently, tigers and lions have become the centre of a cruel and barbaric attraction. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists and celebrities.

However, these animals are drugged up and live in vile conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has worked hard at ending animal cruelty and continues to do so. However, much of Thailand is only just recognising the concept of animal welfare. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists.

However, the truth behind these 'tiger selfies' is a sad and heart-breaking scene. The animals are drugged to ensure they are 'safe' to have selfies with. Furthermore, the conditions in which they are kept are cramped and filthy.

attributes.action: Revoke Section 74 of the LLA Act 2007 that permits the reuse of graves
attributes.background: Section 74 of the London Local Authorities Act 2007 permits a burial authority to disturb human remains for the purposes of re-using the graves, but Cemeteries are failing to locate people who may have an inherited right. The current procedure is not adequate to identify potential owners of graves.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Government to develop new legislation in this field to ensure re-use of graves is only permitted where permission from the grave owner or their relatives, as defined by the regulation, is given.

Graves and memorials provide a tangible link to our past, assist genealogical research but primarily form part of our heritage and encourage acts of Respect and Remembrance, but they are currently being abused.

attributes.action: Make Letting Fees illegal in England, like they are in Scotland
attributes.background: The fees letting agents charge have gotten out of hand, you can lay out a lot of hard cash, and lose it if you fail the reference, credit, or guarantor, stages of applying for a Tenancy, the cost of the Tenancy itself can be ridiculous, it's illegal in Scotland, why not in England?
attributes.additional_details:
I'm looking to move from my present address, (I have social housing) boy was I shocked, when I saw the cost of fees involved in doing so in the private sector. Fees have been illegal in Scotland since 2012, so why is it not the same in England? 
Is it because so many MP's are Landlords (123 was the count in 2017). They won't want to pick up the tab themselves, like they have to in Scotland for these checks, let's force their hand.

attributes.action: UK govt to build a ship which can remove and recycle plastic from the oceans
attributes.background:
There are "islands" of plastic in our oceans which are 1- dangerous to marine life;  2- polluting our world; 3- a waste of resources
4- a human problem.
The UK govt could lead the world by building a ship which can collect the plastic, process it and bring to the UK to reuse the plastic
attributes.additional_details:
Ecological - There are millions of tons of resources lying on the ocean, we put it there, we should retrieve it. 

Resource - The technology exists to collect and re-use that plastic resource (think of it like a natural resource which we can mine and exploit). We can build infrastructure projects with free plastic!

Britain was built on a sea-faring heritage. Post-Brexit, this is an opportunity to show that we still lead the world. 

Finally, why would you or any country say "no"?

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Abolish minimum income floor for the self employed zero contracts and disabled.
attributes.background: The requirement of MIF removes flexibility for the disabled, zero hours contracts and self employed workers, which by nature can be seasonal and erratic.It undermines the contribution that disabled and self employed people make and throttles entrepreneurs who could ultimately go on to employ others.
attributes.additional_details:
An employee earning £12000 a year from employment is topped up with approx £500 of extra support in a month. If a self-employed worker earning £12,000 a year earns an extra £200 in a given month it would reduce their entitlement by £90, while taking home £200 less in another month would increase their entitlement by just £5.How is this fair?

Source: Resolution Foundation

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have been in UK for 7 years
attributes.background: People who lived here more than 7 years have a huge social circle. Everyone is connected to each other. Deporting these immigrants will leave a very bad impact on their familes and local community. If they are legally allowed, govt will get huge revenue in terms of income tax and national insurance.

attributes.action: Make a guarantee for no physical checks at NI side of border nor between GB & NI
attributes.background: The departure from the EU Customs Union means bilateral customs checks between ROI and UK, UK has promised unilaterally no physical border checks from its side between NI and ROI and NI and GB, this promise should be made into a legal guarantee as part of the so called "Great Repeal Bill".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-northern-ireland-border-brexit-eu-hard-no-deal-cabinet-irish-a8235096.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/irish-hard-border-soft-brexit-technology-theresa-may-a8242461.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43277181

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/09/uk-must-set-stone-commitment-no-hard-irish-border-brexit-talks/

https://news.sky.com/story/government-wants-no-changes-to-irish-border-arrangements-10991079

attributes.action: Stop the funding cuts to the police service in Redbridge and adjoining boroughs
attributes.background: There have been a spike in the number of burglaries in Redbridge borough which has caused great concern and fear to the residents within the area. Lack of funding has caused these crimes to go uninvestigated leading to greater frustration in the area.

attributes.action: Go back to the old GCSEs and abolish the new 9-1 Grading system
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are incredibly difficult and it results in many students failing or getting low grades. The new system has set students for failure and has even increased the difficulty to that of the old A-levels. This is inconsiderate and unjust. We must abolish this system.

attributes.action: Reform Private Member's Bill procedure so that an objection needs to be seconded
attributes.background: Evidenced today; Friday 15th June 2018, a Private Members Bill was objected to by a lone MP. The Private Members Bill process allows for Bills to be introduced by MPs and Lords who are not government ministers, furthering the democratic process. The objection by one MP hinders that process.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that parliamentary procedures be modernised. When an opportunity arises where an MP may object to a reading of a Private Bill or Private Member Bill, any objection must be seconded by another MP for it to be recognised. This change will allow for the democratic process to represent the electorate without it being compromised by a lone voice.

attributes.action: Introduce renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in UK for 14 years
attributes.background: The previous immigration law allows anyone who has been in the UK for 14years to be eligible for permanent residence. However, this was removed in 2010 with government view to removing all overstayers even if they have been in the UK for more than 14years.
attributes.additional_details:
However, recent government reports showed there have been no changes to the number of people deported who have been in the UK for 14years or more as these sets of people are either already have a settled family.

In the light of the above, the government should introduce legal renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in the UK for more than 14 years without a criminal record so that these sets of people will be able to work legally, contribute to the UK economy positively and pay taxes.

attributes.action: Fund baby hatches to allow newborns to be left safely and anonymously
attributes.background:
There have been several cases of newborn babies being abandoned. Most recently and sadly was the case of baby Pearl in Rochdale, Manchester who was found dead in the woods. 
Many countries have baby hatches to allow babies to be abandoned safely, where they can receive immediate attention.
attributes.additional_details:
Belgium, Germany and Canada have introduced baby hatches where a parent can abandon their newborn baby anonymously. This means that despite this desperate act, the infant is safe and warm and an alert is generated so that someone arrives to care for the child straight away. 
This is scheme is needed in the UK to ensure that these parents have a safe space to leave their child and do not have to resort to leaving the infant at risk.

attributes.action: Stop assessing higher education students on their parental income!
attributes.background: As a student In a living in a city, being able to survive on student finance is challenging. Like most students the money I have to survive on is assessed by parental income, not taking into account mortgages and other bills to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Many students I've spoken to are in a similar situation, Their parents would love to help them out with an additional £3-£4k per year but financially aren't in this position. Thus meaning they are unable to support us as student finance believes they should/could.

Due to the lack of student finance for our future workforce, we are forced into overdrafts before leaving education.

attributes.action: New law on the ratio of qualified staff/carers to patients in nursing homes
attributes.background: My father was neglected in a care home. There is no minimum legal ratio or a requirement on public or private care facilities to employ a minimum number of staff. I have spent 5 years speaking, researching and gleaning information on this matter.
attributes.additional_details: I had to employ the services of my local MP who contacted The Care Quality Commission on my behalf. I should have been listened to immediately and my concerns taken seriously without having to involve my MP. I have spoken with many carers/qualified nursing staff in nursing homes and in the community, and they believe, that there is neglect is because there is no legal ratio requirement.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: UK Government should urge India to stop mob lynching and crime against women.
attributes.background: UK Government should ask India to stop mob lynching and stop crime against women in India and take action against Saffron Terrorists who are killing minorities including Muslims and Christians.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government should ask United Nations Commission on Human Rights to take notice of what is happening in India.

86% of those killed in cow-related violence since 2010 are Muslim, 97% attacks after Modi govt came to power-https://m.hindustantimes.com/india-news/86-killed-in-cow-related-violence-since-2010-are-muslims-97-attacks-after-modi-govt-came-to-power/story-w9CYOksvgk9joGSSaXgp”

attributes.action: Allow postgraduate students the right to financial support for childcare.
attributes.background: Postgraduate students are not classed as eligible for working tax credits, nor are they recognized as students due to not being in receipt of a student loan. This excludes parents from receiving financial support for childcare that is afforded to working parents or undergraduate parents.
attributes.additional_details: Discrimination of parents wishing to complete postgraduate study means they are financially excluded from completing positions which, if afforded support for childcare costs, they would be able to complete. Following postgraduate study, when in employment they would pay a higher rate of tax and would contribute more to the repayment of undergraduate loans. As it stands parents of young children are financially  better off remaining on income support than pursuing funded postgraduate positions.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all drivers and bikers to have an onboard camera
attributes.background: My husband was killed in May 2017 while he was doing 15mph on his motorbike. We have never had answers as to what happened that day. There we're 3 other vehicles involved and all statements were different. I feel if they had cameras we would have answers.

attributes.action: Extend Sunday trading hours
attributes.background: To increase the trading hours to match the other 6 days of the week would increase revenue and employment. Sunday trading laws are out dated and the product of an old fashioned mindset.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Change the official name & branding of the House of Lords to the House of Peers
attributes.background:
While over 25% of the members of the House of Lords are women, the name erases their existence, ignores their achievements and puts a gendered restriction in the heart of our nation's Parliament.

By changing the official name to the House of Peers, along with all branding, we can fix this mistake
attributes.additional_details: Today is International Women's Day 2018, sixty years since women were first allowed to sit as peers. If we could change our Parliament's name by IWD 2019 to include the 209 female peers who help make our country's laws, that would be a wonderful celebration of 60 years of women in British democracy.

attributes.action: Guarantee divorced/separated parents a minimum level of access to their children
attributes.background: Without a court order a divorced/ seperated parent has no automatic right to see their children. I’d like there to be a set minimum level of access granted to parents without the need for court orders that may take a long time to approve and are very costly to obtain.

attributes.action: Include cycle paths in post-Brexit farming subsidies
attributes.background: Rewarding farmers for providing cycle paths across farmland, would offer safe routes to schools and work, connecting villages and towns. This would reduce pollution, provide leisure opportunities, compensate for lost bus services and contribute to the well being of the nation.

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Add the discrimination against people with tattoos to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Currently the discrimination against people with tattoos in and out the work place is evident within the UK, we need to ensure people with tattoos are safe guarded against discrimination

attributes.action: Bring back our job center to Darwen
attributes.background: Bring back our job center to Darwen which closed early this year without even asking the people of darwen if this was ok
attributes.additional_details:
UNEMPLOYED people in parts of East Lancashire will face extra 10 mile round-trips after the Department of Work and Pensions announced it will merge two jobcentres with nearby sites.

As a result of an estates review by the DWP, jobcentres in Green Street, Darwen, and Market Street, Colne, will now be axed.

attributes.action: Recruit at least 20,000 more police officers.
attributes.background: There is a national crises. Volumes of emergencies have increased rapidly in the last 5 years. Speed is the key to solving crimes and there is the "golden hour" which is often missed causing loss of evidence resulting in not finding perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Figures obtained from the BBC Police under pressure programme on 16th May 2018. Police themselves are under threat from organised gangs who are aware of police limitations.  There have been 23,000 assaults on officers in 2014/15 alone. Not all assaults get reported. The rate of physical assault against police officers being almost 12 times the "all occupations" rate. Cracks are now beginning to show, increasing amounts of risk to public safety because there are less and less officers and staff.

attributes.action: Make AED Defibrillators available more publicly (at least every second street).
attributes.background: AED Defibrillators are a crucial part of basic first aid. Cardiac arrest involves a person being on the verge of dying. Cardiopulmonary Resusictation (CPR) is effective but AED defibrillators may double the chance of a person surviving. This could potentially save your or a loved one life.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Heart Foundation, 100,000 people die from sudden cardiac arrest each year. Without treatment, 95% of the time a cardiac arrest results in death. Having a defibrillator in close proximity is vital, as 80% of cardiac arrests occur at home, with every minute of it being untreated the chance of survival falls by 9%. Having a defibrillator in every street or two, and making neighbors aware of it saves valuable time in treatment and thousands of lives!
Sign up to Save!

attributes.action: Build and repair road surfaces using the plastic waste produced in the UK
attributes.background: Households in the UK produce 22 million tonnes of waste per year and only 44% is recycled. Our country keeps exporting our waste (particularly plastic) to other far shores. Since China have introduced a ban against this, the government are searching for new places to export.
attributes.additional_details: The Netherlands have recently introduced the usage of recycled plastics in the re-surfacing and building of road surfaces. Not only does it recycle the waste that we create, but it also reduces CO2 damage caused by the original asphalt. This surface can withstand extreme temperatures from -40 degrees to 80 degrees. Many road surfaces desperately require repair and this is a quick, simple solution that forces our country to take responsibility for our negative environmental impact.

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.

attributes.action: Minimum of 10 years for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Too many people are being killed by drivers being drunk, on drugs or using mobile phones will driving.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Change the methods the Government use to record Homelessness
attributes.background: The methods currently used by the Government to record Homelessness portray unrealistic results. Many people are concealed in the 'hidden homelessness' category as they sofa surf or move around on the streets. Current figures are an underestimate, many are not included in the official statistics.
attributes.additional_details: Many people who the average citizen would classify as homeless are neglected from the record as they do not fit Government criteria. We cannot ignore the lives of individuals simply because they are not "lying down in the street" and instead are hiding in the crevice of a doorway. If the Government change the way they record homelessness to give a more representative statistic, as a united country we can tackle this issue with full knowledge of what we are facing.

attributes.action: Make sure that there are recycling bins in the classrooms of every school.
attributes.background: As a student, everyday I see a shocking amount of paper go to landfill. I understand that in the current environmental climate, we should be doing all we can to create minimal waste. By ensuring there are recycling bins in every classroom teachers and students could be compelled to act.
attributes.additional_details: Every day students are using worksheets and paper in lesson, however, instead of putting used paper in a recycling bin it is put in the normal bins to go to landfill. I find this shocking, I myself believe that recycling is such an easy way to prevent waste going to landfill sites. There is an easy way to combat this problem, by ensuring every classroom in every school across the country has a recycling bin, many more teachers and students could be compelled to recycle their paper.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Make It Mandatory for Employers to Educate Employees on "Employment Rights"
attributes.background:
Discrimination at work is a harsh reality of British Labour Market. This is mainly due to lack of training among the employers and lack of understanding of rights among the employees. 
The only way to protect ourselves and next generation is to make it mandatory for employers to educate their staff
attributes.additional_details:
Equality and Human Rights Commission on 21/12/2017 reported that ethnic minorities have a 12.9% higher unemployment rate.

Black workers with degrees earn 23.1% less on average.

In Britain, only 8.8% of the minorities worked at a manager level or higher.

Based on GOV statistics from Jan-Sep 2017:
13% of the jurisdictional complaints were related to Equal Pay
11.7% for discrimination of some kind.

These numbers are alarming!

So please sign the petition and protect our rights.EDUCATE EMPLOYEES

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Ban the Nazi salute in the UK
attributes.background: The Nazi salute is an insult to those who fought and died for peace during World War Two. Therefore it should be banned in the UK because it offends the Jewish community.

attributes.action: Make employers offer part-time working for new parents
attributes.background: Lots of parents who worked full time before having children are unable to do so once the child is born. At present employers are allowed to consider part-time options but they do not have to honour them leaving new mums and dads no option but to resign. The same job level should also be available.
attributes.additional_details: Returning to a role after having a baby is difficult enough, it seems that if you want part-time you have to fight for it and if it is granted the job level you were at before is not always made available to you. I believe that it should be compulsory to offer a part time role at the same level. Parents should not be penalised in the workplace for having a child.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.
